page.title: 17Interviews 3
page.content:
The{boy}interviewed was named Philip, and was{11 years old.}He had lived in the village for 6 years. There were six people in his family; his{mother was a housewife and his {father milked cows.
He{missed the facilities of a town, but his parents did their{shopping in {Thetford.
He had{two dogs and a cat as pets, and earned pocket money by cleaning out the dogs. There was nothing on which to spend his money.{He did not {belong to any groups like the scouts, and there was{no youth centre in the {village,}but he had a bicycle. His {main pastime was fishing.
